profile_data.summary:
With over 5 years of experience in designing and optimizing data pipelines and  software engineering, I specialize in delivering scalable, high-performance solutions. My expertise spans end-to-end data pipeline production, from data ingestion and transformation to API integration, enabling real-time data access and insights for key stakeholders.

Having worked with cloud platforms like GCP and AWS, I bring a strong technical foundation in Python, SQL, Apache Airflow, and BigQuery, with a focus on automation, data quality, and optimization. I have led teams, mentored engineers, and consistently driven results.

Passionate about leveraging data to drive business impact, Iâ€™m always excited to tackle new challenges in the fields of data engineering and/or software development
profile_data.headline: Senior Data Engineer @CVS Health

publications.name: An Open Repository of Real-Time COVID-19 Indicators
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
publications.description: The COVID-19 pandemic presented enormous data challenges in the United States. Policy makers, epidemiological modelers, and health researchers all require up-to-date data on the pandemic and relevant public behavior, ideally at fine spatial and temporal resolution. The COVIDcast API is our attempt to fill this need: operational since April 2020, it provides open access to both traditional public health surveillance signals (cases, deaths, and hospitalizations) and many auxiliary indicators of COVID19 activity, such as signals extracted from de-identified medical claims data, massive online surveys, cell phone mobility data, and internet search trends. This paper describes the data sources and signals, and provides examples demonstrating that the auxiliary signals in the COVIDcast API present information relevant to tracking COVID activity, augmenting traditional public health reporting and empowering research and decision-making.

projects.description:
Designed an RFID based Home Automation System using Embedded C to secure houses
through Smart Cards; when correct card is scanned on the RFID, door gets unlocked, fan starts rotating and the room lights up; if
wrong card is scanned, system gets locked and an alarm is invoked suggesting an unusual activity has happened.
projects.title: Home Automation System
